words.def: humorously sarcastic or mocking
a toxic protein extracted from castor beans
the dialect of Ancient Greek spoken and written in Attica and Athens and Ionia
a flat metal piece (usually a disc) used as money
(computer science) a graphic symbol (usually a simple picture) that denotes a program or a command or a data file or a concept in a graphical user interface
tall annual cereal grass bearing kernels on large ears: widely cultivated in America in many varieties
stiff coarse fiber from the outer husk of a coconut
A small decorative box, hung from the sash of a kimono, for holding small objects.
A type of seaweed, laver, chopped and formed into sheets, used in the preparation of sushi.
A production in the style of film noir .
a heavy ductile magnetic metallic element
an argument opposed to a proposal
City in Brazil (Proper noun)
Any of several large, ferocious sea creatures, now especially the killer whale .
A Hebrew measure of capacity; a core or homer.
mythical bird of prey having enormous size and strength
a particle that is electrically charged (positive or negative)
A binary operator composite of NOT OR; negation of OR function.
a negative
a state in northwestern United States on the Pacific
in operation or operational
A working-class punk rock  subgenre of the 1970s, sometimes associated with racism.
a unit of length equal to one twelfth of a foot
